::: {.question-block}

<form onsubmit="event.preventDefault(); checkAnswer('module5_mcq_q54')" data-correct-answer="C">
<strong style="display: block;">A mutual fund manager can generate α = 2% on up to $400m of assets. Beyond that, α = 0. The fund charges 1% fees on AUM. At equilibrium, how much will the fund manage?</strong>

<label><input type="radio" name="module5_mcq_q54" value="A"> A. $400m</label><br>
<label><input type="radio" name="module5_mcq_q54" value="B"> B. $600m</label><br>
<label><input type="radio" name="module5_mcq_q54" value="C"> C. $800m</label><br>
<label><input type="radio" name="module5_mcq_q54" value="D"> D. $1,000m</label><br>
<label><input type="radio" name="module5_mcq_q54" value="E"> E. $1,200m</label><br>
</form>

<div id="feedback-module5_mcq_q54" class="feedback" data-status="" style="display:none;">
✅ Correct: C. At equilibrium, investors push α_net = 0. $400m × 2% = $8m. Fees = 1% of AUM → AUM = $800m.
</div>
